item.title: Steven add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "You must not suppose, because I am a man of letters, that I never tried to earn an honest living." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Steven add a quote by Don Marquis
item.description: "Publishing a book of poetry is like dropping a rose petal down the Grand Canyon and waiting for the echo." -- Don Marquis

item.title: Steven add a quote by Ahmed Ibn Fadlan
item.description: "Merciful Father.... I have squandered my days with plans of many things. This was not among them. But at this moment, I beg only, to live the next few minutes well. For all we ought to have thought and have not thought... All we ought to have said and have not said. All we ought to have done and have not done. I pray thee, God for forgiveness." -- Ahmed Ibn Fadlan

item.title: Steven add a quote by Oliver Goldsmith
item.description: "Every absurdity has a champion to defend it." -- Oliver Goldsmith

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Few things are harder to put up with than the annoyance of a good example." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The secret source of humor is not joy but sorrow; there is no humor in heaven." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steven add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve immortality through not dying. I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen; I want to live on in my apartment." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Steven add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "We may convince others by our arguements, but we can only persuade them by their own" -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Steven add a quote by Douglas Jerrold
item.description: "a conservative is a man who will not look at the new moon, out of respect for that 'ancient institution,' the old one" -- Douglas Jerrold

item.title: Steven add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "theology is to religion what poisons are to food" -- Voltaire

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is the only animal that blushes. Or needs to." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Steven add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "Youth is a blunder; manhood a struggle; old age a regret." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Steven add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The battle that never ends is the battle of belief against disbelief" -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Steven add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Steven add a quote by Lin Yutang
item.description: "If you can spend a perfectly useless afternoon in a perfectly useless manner, you have learned how to live" -- Lin Yutang

item.title: Steven add a quote by Lin Yutang
item.description: "Besides the noble art of getting things done, there is the noble art of leaving things undone. The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of non-essentials." -- Lin Yutang

item.title: Steven add a quote by Lin Yutang
item.description: "The busy man is never wise and the wise man is never busy." -- Lin Yutang

item.title: Steven add a quote by Lin Yutang
item.description: "The wise man reads both books and life itself." -- Lin Yutang

item.title: Steven add a quote by Phil Simpkin
item.description: "Self publishing' is not as easy as it is portrayed! When you think you have finished your book, proof read, proof read again, and again, and again. Don't believe it is ready until you have a hard copy proofed!" -- Phil Simpkin

item.title: Steven add a quote by Mickey Mantle
item.description: "If I knew I was going to live so long, I'd have taken better care of myself." -- Mickey Mantle

item.title: Steven add a quote by Alan Wilson Watts
item.description: "Advice? I don’t have advice. Stop aspiring and start writing. If you’re writing, you’re a writer. Write like you’re a goddamn death row inmate and the governor is out of the country and there’s no chance for a pardon. Write like you’re clinging to the edge of a cliff, white knuckles, on your last breath, and you’ve got just one last thing to say, like you’re a bird flying over us and you can see everything, and please, for God’s sake, tell us something that will save us from ourselves. Take a deep breath and tell us your deepest, darkest secret, so we can wipe our brow and know that we’re not alone. Write like you have a message from the king. Or don’t. Who knows, maybe you’re one of the lucky ones who doesn’t have to." -- Alan Wilson Watts

item.title: Steven add a quote by John Cleese
item.description: "Why write about the past? Well, there's more of it." -- John Cleese

item.title: Steven add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The earth laughs in flowers." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Steven add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "I ask of literature precisely those things of which I feel the lack in my own life." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Steven add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Wealth is evidently not the good we are seeking; for it is merely useful and for the sake of something else." -- Aristotle

item.title: Steven add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Steven add a quote by Lionel Trilling
item.description: "We who are liberal and progressive know that the poor are our equals in every sense except that of being equal to us. " -- Lionel Trilling

item.title: Steven add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "Mastery of language affords one remarkable opportunities." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Steven add a quote by Edgar Rice Burroughs
item.description: "If I had followed my better judgment always, my life would have been a very dull one." -- Edgar Rice Burroughs
